title: The heart of Midlothian;
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: " Muckle better — muckle better ; God bless yon — God bless you ! At no rate let him gang till ye hear frae me," eaid Jeanie.

title: Abbotsford and Newstead abbey.
author: Irving, Washington
snippet: The story goes, that after long labouring in mind, between the altar and the halter, the love of life prevailed, and the youth resigned himself to the charms of Muckle-mouthed Mag.

title: Abbotsford and Newstead abbey.
author: Irving, Washington
snippet: On one side of him was Muckle-mouthed Mag, with an amorous smile across the whole breadth of her countenance, and a leer enough to turn a man to stone ; on the other side was the father confessor, a sleek friar, jogging the youth's elbow, and pointing to the gallows, seen in perspective through the open portal.

title: Abbotsford and Newstead abbey.
author: Irving, Washington
snippet: The last may be thought an easy alternative, but unfortunately, the baron's young lady was hideously ugly, with a mouth from ear to ear, so that not a suiter was to be had for her, either for love or money, and she was known throughout the border country by the name of Muckle-mouthed Mag !
